meanings.sent1: She keeps hyperbolizing about how long she waited in line.
meanings.sent2: Stop hyperbolizing your achievements; just be honest.
meanings.sent3: He was hyperbolizing so much that no one believed his stories anymore.
meanings.sent4: Her hyperbolizing turned a small mistake into a major disaster.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's hyperbolizing made the audience burst into laughter.

meanings.definition: The act of making something seem more dramatic or extreme than it really is
meanings.sent1: His hyperbolizing of the situation made everyone panic unnecessarily.
meanings.sent2: The hyperbolizing in the movie made it more entertaining.
meanings.sent3: The hyperbolizing in his speech made everyone roll their eyes.
meanings.sent4: The hyperbolizing of the storm's impact caused unnecessary fear among the residents.
meanings.sent5: The hyperbolizing in her writing brought the characters to life.
